news.title: Kodansha USA License Announcements at Anime Expo 2023
news.text:
The Kodansha USA panel at Anime Expo 2023 announced the acquisition of 19 new titles and the print release for three existing licenses. In addition, the publisher also announced a third box set for Ijiranaide, Nagatoro-san (Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro) as well as the omnibus release for four titles.

July 2023 Digital Licenses

Boku no Okusan wa Chotto Kowai by Aguri Kurita
English title: My Wife is a Little Intimidating

Release date: July 4, 2023


Teppuu by Moare Ohta
English title: Teppu

Release date: July 18, 2023

Spring 2024 Print Licenses

Adou by Jaku Amano
English title: A-DO


Ao no Miburo by Tsuyoshi Yasuda
English title: The Blue Wolves of Mibu


Bless by Yukino Sonoyama



Bokura wo Hedateru Ao to Shiro by Kiyuhiko
English title: The White and Blue Between Us


Douse, Koishite Shimaunda. by Haruka Mitsui
English title: Anyway, I'm Falling in Love with You.

Licensed digitally since 2021


Fairy Tail by Hiro Mashima

Omnibus Edition (2-in-1)


Ijiranaide, Nagatoro-san by 774
English title: Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro

Box Set 3: Includes volumes 13-18


Initial D by Shuuichi Shigeno

Omnibus Edition (2-in-1)


Kaoru Hana wa Rin to Saku by Saka Mikami
English title: The Fragrant Flower Blooms with Dignity

Licensed digitally since 2023


Kei x Yaku: Abunai Aibou by Yoshie Kaoruhara
English title: Kei x Yaku: Bound by Law


Kimi no Yokogao wo Miteita by Rumi Ichinohe
English title: I See Your Face, Turned Away


Kyonyuu Suki nanoni BL-kai ni Tensei shimashita by Tsukiji Nao
English title: I Got Reincarnated in a (BL) World of Big (Man) Boobs

Omnibus Edition (2-in-1)


Lonely Girl ni Sakaraenai by Kashikaze
English title: I Can't Say No to the Lonely Girl


Machigitsune to Hito no Ko by Nmura

English title: The Yearning Fox Lies in Wait


Medalist by Tsurumaikada

Licensed digitally since 2021


Ninja to Gokudou by Shinsuke Kondou
English title: Ninja vs. Gokudo


Noisy Roommate: Ienashi ni Natta node Ikemen to Kaii Tsukimono Ken de Doukyo Hajimemashita by Kaho Ozaki
English title: My Noisy Roommate: The Roof Over My Head Comes With Monsters and a Hottie


Nude Model: Yamaguchi Tsubasa Tanpenshuu by Tsubasa Yamaguchi
English title: Nude Model: Tsubasa Yamaguchi Short Stories


Number Call by Nagisa Furuya


Online Game Nakama to Sashi Off shitara Shokuba no Oni Joushi ga Kita by Nmura
English title: Turns Out My Online Friend is My Real-Life Boss!

Omnibus Edition (2-in-1)


Ooyukiumi no Kaina by Tsutomu Nihei and Itoe Takemoto
English title: Kaina of the Great Snow Sea


Sketchy by Hirochi Maki


Tonari no Stella by Ammitsu
English title: Gazing at the Star Next Door


Tsukanoma no Ichika by Natsu Tadano
English title: A Brief Moment of Ichika


Yubisaki to Renren by Suu Morishita
English title: A Sign of Affection

Omnibus Edition (3-in-1)
Source: Press Release

news.title: 'Undead Girl Murder Farce' Unveils Additional Cast
news.text:
The official website of the Undead Girl Murder Farce television anime series revealed on Tuesday additional cast and a new visual for the Vampire arc (pictured). The anime premiered on July 6 at 12:55 a.m. on Fuji TV's +Ultra programming block.

Cast
Lord Godard: Hiroyuki Kinoshita (Ajin)
Claude: Hirofumi Nojima (Pandora Hearts)
Raoul: Shouya Chiba (86)
Charlotte: Afumi Hashi (Uma Musume: Pretty Derby)
Alfred: Ryo Nishizawa
Giselle: Ai Fukada (Cuticle Tantei Inaba)
Marc: Mitsuru Hofu

Mamoru Hatakeyama (Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen) directs the anime at Lapin Track. Noboru Takagi (Golden Kamuy) is handling the series composition and Noriko Itou (Boukyaku Battery) is designing the characters. yuma yamaguchi (Shiguang Dailiren) is composing the music.

The anime adapts Yuugo Asoaki's mystery novel, which he began writing under the Kodansha Taiga imprint in December 2015 and released three volumes as of April 2021.

Haruka Tomoyama began drawing the manga adaptation in Shounen Sirius magazine in May 2016. The manga transferred to Nemesis magazine in June 2017 and then transferred again to Comic Days website in June 2018 after Nemesis ceased publication. Kodansha shipped the third volume in June 2018.

Kodansha USA licensed the manga in English and released the third volume in July 2021.

Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: 'Madogiwa no Totto-chan' Unveils Lead Cast, Trailer, December 8 Opening
news.text:
The official website of the anime movie adapting Tetsuko Kuroyanagi's Madogiwa no Totto-chan (Totto-chan: The Little Girl at the Window) autobiographical novel revealed the lead cast, a trailer, and teaser visual (pictured) on Tuesday.

Liliana Oono is starring as the main character Totto-chan after winning an audition. The movie will premiere in theaters in Japan on December 8.

Staff
Director: Shinnosuke Yakuwa (Doraemon Movie 34 & 36)
Script: Shinnosuke Yakuwa, Yousuke Suzuki
Character Design: Shizue Kaneko (Isekai Maou to Shoukan Shoujo no Dorei Majutsu, Adachi to Shimamura)
Music: Yuuji Nomi (Nichijou, Mimi wo Sumaseba)
Studio: Shin-Ei Animation

Kuroyanagi penned Madogiwa no Totto-chan in 1981, which became an instant bestseller in post-war Japan. The title has also been published in 35 countries and won the Janusz Korczak Award in Poland in 1985. As of March 2021, the novel has a cumulative circulation of 23 million copies worldwide.

Synopsis
This engaging series of childhood recollections tells about an ideal school in Tokyo during World War II that combined learning with fun, freedom, and love. This unusual school had old railroad cars for classrooms, and it was run by an extraordinary man—its founder and headmaster, Sousaku Kobayashi—who was a firm believer in freedom of expression and activity. (Source: Kodansha International, edited)

Trailer


Official site: https://tottochan-movie.jp/
Official Twitter: @tottochan_movie

Source: Movie Walker

Madogiwa no Totto-chan on MAL

news.title: 'Kaii to Otome to Kamikakushi' Unveils Main Cast, 2024 Premiere
news.text:
The official website for the television anime adaptation of Nujima's Kaii to Otome to Kamikakushi (Mysteries, Maidens and Mysterious Disappearances) manga revealed on Monday the main pair of cast. The anime is scheduled to premiere in 2024.


Sumireko Ogawa: Ai Fairouz (Chainsaw Man, JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 6: Stone Ocean)


Ren Adashino: Daiki Yamashita (Boku no Hero Academia, JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 5: Ougon no Kaze)


Nujima began drawing the mystery supernatural manga on Shogakukan's Yawaraka Spirits website in October 2019. Shogakukan shipped the sixth volume was released on July 12.

Source: animate Times

news.title: 'Keikenzumi na Kimi to, Keiken Zero na Ore ga, Otsukiai suru Hanashi.' Unveils Additional Cast, Theme Songs, First Promo, Fall 2023 Premiere
news.text:
The official website of the Keikenzumi na Kimi to, Keiken Zero na Ore ga, Otsukiai suru Hanashi. (Our Dating Story: The Experienced You and The Inexperienced Me) television anime unveiled additional cast members, theme songs, the first promo, and a new visual (pictured) on Sunday. The anime is set to air in October 2023.

Cast
Maria Kurose: Aoi Koga (Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen)
Nikoru Yamana: Ayaka Fukuhara (Kawaii dake ja Nai Shikimori-san)
Akari Tanikita: Tomori Kusunoki (Chainsaw Man)
Yuusuke Ijichi: Fukushi Ochiai (Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san)
Ren Nishina: Daisuke Sakaguchi (Clannad)
Shuugo Sekiya: Tomoaki Maeno (Death Parade)
KEN: KUN

Maaya Uchida (Seishun Buta Yarou wa Bunny Girl Senpai no Yume wo Minai) is performing the opening theme "Love You Tender!" which is previewed in the promotional video below. AliA is performing the ending theme "Ai Kotoba."

Hideaki Ooba (Koroshi Ai) is directing the television anime at ENGI. Hiroko Fukuda (Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san Movie) is handling the series composition, and Yousuke Itou (Tantei wa Mou, Shindeiru.) is designing the characters. Kei Haneoka (Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen) is composing the music.

The anime adapts Makiko Nagaoka's romance light novel, which began publishing in Fujimi Fantasia Bunko in September 2020, featuring illustrations by magako. The sixth volume was shipped on March 17.

Gangan Online began serializing a manga adaptation by Noyama Carpaccio in February 2022. Square Enix published the third volume on April 12 and began publishing the manga as You Were Experienced, I Was Not: Our Dating Story digitally in English on its Manga UP! website and app on June 22.

PV


Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: Manga 'The Fable' Gets TV Anime
news.text:
Production company VAP opened an official website for a television anime adaptation of Katsuhisa Minami's The Fable manga on Monday. The website also revealed the main staff and a teaser visual (pictured).

Staff
Director: Ryousuke Takahashi (Gasaraki, Hi no Tori)
Series Composition: Yuuya Takashima
Script: Yuuya Takashima, Mayumi Morita (Kanojo mo Kanojo, Young Black Jack)
Character Design: Kyuuma Ooshita (Top Secret: The Revelation, Rocket Girls), Saki Hasegawa (Ao Ashi, Shin Chuuka Ichiban!), Junichi Hayama (Pet, JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken)
Studio: Tezuka Productions

Minami began serializing the action comedy manga in Weekly Young Magazine from November 2014 to November 2019. A manga sequel began in July 2021 in the same magazine. Kodansha shipped the sequel's seventh volume on May 8, with the eighth volume scheduled to go on sale on August 4. The Fable has a cumulative of over 22 million copies in circulation.

Kodansha USA licensed the first manga series in English in March 2022 and released the 15th volume on June 13. The 16th volume will ship on July 11.

The Fable won at the 41st Kodansha Manga Awards in the General category in 2017. The manga was also placed twice in the Kono Manga ga Sugoi! rankings in the Male Readers' Top 20 in the 2019 and 2020's editions.

Synopsis
Fable is a legendary hitman who has completed numerous jobs for a variety of clients. After concluding his latest assignment, the number of people he has recently killed becomes too high, and Fable is ordered by his boss to lay low for a year. He is suggested that having to adapt to life as an ordinary citizen might prove a valuable experience for his future work.

Fable is to be accompanied by the woman who acts as his driver, and the two will assume new identities as siblings. However, their boss warns them that they will both face a deadly punishment if Fable kills anyone during his time off. Thus begins Akira and Youko Satou's joint one-year sabbatical from the underworld. [Written by MAL Rewrite]

Official site: https://www.vap.co.jp/the-fable-anime/
Official Twitter: @the_fable_anime

Source: animate Times

The Fable on MAL

news.title: 'Yuru Camp△' Season 3 Reveals Main Staff, Returning Cast, 2024 Premiere
news.text:
The official website of the Yuru Camp△ television anime series revealed on Sunday the main staff, returning cast, and a teaser visual (pictured) for the third season. The anime is scheduled to premiere in 2024.

Staff
Director: Shin Tosaka (IS: Infinite Stratos 2, Regalia: The Three Sacred Stars)
Series Composition: Masafumi Sugiura (Uma Musume: Pretty Derby, Barakamon)
Character Design: Takanori Hashimoto (Kitsutsuki Tanteidokoro main animator, Nakitai Watashi wa Neko wo Kaburu animation director)
Music: Akiyuki Tateyama (Yuru Camp△, Genjitsu Shugi Yuusha no Oukoku Saikenki)
Sound Director: Takeshi Takadera (Yuru Camp△, "Oshi no Ko")
Studio: 8bit

The main cast, composed of Nao Touyama, Yumiri Hanamori, Aki Toyosaki, Sayuri Hara, and Rie Takahashi, are reprising their roles from the previous entries.

C-Station produced the first and second season in Winter 2018 and Winter 2021. The studio also produced the Heya Camp△ (Room Camp) short spin-off which aired in Winter 2020 and the Yuru Camp△ Movie that opened in theaters in July last year. Crunchyroll simulcast both seasons, the spin-off, and the movie with subtitles.

Yuru Camp△ adapts Afro's slice of life manga, which began serialization in Manga Time Kirara Forward in May 2015 before transferring to Comic Fuz in 2019. Houbunsha shipped the 14th volume on November 10.

Yen Press licensed the manga in English in April 2017. The 13th volume went on sale on April 18 and the 14th volume is scheduled to release on October 17.

Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: Original TV Anime 'Bokura no Ameiro Protocol' Announced for Fall 2023
news.text:
An official website opened for an original television anime titled Bokura no Ameiro Protocol (Our Rainy Protocol) on Saturday, revealing the main cast, staff, teaser visual (pictured), and teaser promotional video. The anime is scheduled to premiere on TV Asahi's 24 affiliated channels on the NUMAnimation programming block, followed by Miyazaki Broadcasting and BS Asahi in October 2023.

Synopsis
Shun Tokinoya is a second-year high school student who lives with his mother and younger sister. After his father was killed in an accident and his sister was injured, he quit the game he loved and now works at an esports café called "FOX ONE." He spends all of his time studying and working part-time, while also socializing with his childhood gaming buddies. Suddenly, he discovers that "FOX ONE" is deeply in debt. Shun and his friends hope to win the "Xaxerion Championship" and the prize money in order to repay their debts. Shun returns to the world of online games, where he is confronted by Bakuretsu-kun, who used to play the game with him.

Cast
Shun Tokinoya: Kensho Ono (Kuroko no Basket)
Yuu Saegusa: Sora Amamiya (Kanojo, Okarishimasu)
Nozomi Inatsuki: Inori Minase (5-toubun no Hanayome)
Mio Tokinoya: Momo Asakura (Horimiya)
Akito Sendou: Ryouhei Kimura (Grand Blue)

Staff
Chief Director: Yasutaka Yamamoto (Noblesse director)
Director: Daishi Katou (Warau Arsnotoria Sun! episode director)
Original Story: Kotsukotsu (Aharen-san wa Hakarenai script)
Series Composition: Katsuhiko Takayama (Sekai Saikou no Ansatsusha, Isekai Kizoku ni Tensei suru), Yasutaka Yamamoto
Original Character Design: booota (Hige wo Soru. Soshite Joshikousei wo Hirou.)
Character Design: Kanna Hirayama ("Oshi no Ko")
Music: Satoru Kousaki (Beastars), MONACA (Summertime Render)
Studio: Quad

Teaser PV


Official site: https://bokuame.com/
Official Twitter: @bokuame_anime

Source: Comic Natalie

Shun Tokinoya is a second-year high school student who lives with his mother and younger sister. After his father was killed in an accident and his sister was injured, he quit the game he loved and now works at an esports café called "FOX ONE." He spends all of his time studying and working part-time, while also socializing with his childhood gaming buddies. Suddenly, he discovers that "FOX ONE" is deeply in debt. Shun and his friends hope to win the "Xaxerion Championship" and the prize money in order to repay their debts. Shun returns to the world of online games, where he is confronted by Bakuretsu-kun, who used to play the game with him.

news.title: 'Shangri-La Frontier: Kusoge Hunter, Kamige ni Idoman to su' Reveals Additional Staff, Second Promo
news.text:
The official website of the Shangri-La Frontier: Kusoge Hunter, Kamige ni Idoman to su television anime revealed additional staff and a second promo on Friday. The anime will have two consecutive cours scheduled to premiere in October 2023 at 5:00 p.m. on Sunday on MBS and TBS' 28 affiliated stations.

Staff
Monster Design: Yoshihiro Nagamori (Bakugan Battle Brawlers character design), Hiroyuki Taiga (Elfen Lied mechanical design), Emi Kouno (Majo no Tabitabi chief animation director), Hiroshi Arisawa (Tsuki ga Michibiku Isekai Douchuu)
Prop Design: Yuki Yokoyama (Edomae Elf), Emi Kouno
Main Animator: Ryou Haga (Tensei shitara Ken deshita), Fuminori Tsukida (No Game No Life: Zero), Takeshi Nishino (One Piece Film: Z), Jianghao Yao, Shunya Nitta
Action Animation Director: Rena Hiura (Ousama Ranking animation director), Reika Hoshino (Shingeki no Kyojin animation director)
Chief In-Between Animation Supervisor: Tomoya Takahashi (Tensei shitara Ken deshita)
Color Design Assistant: Sakiko Teguramori (Majo no Tabitabi)
Art Director: Yuuki Nobe (Inspired) (Ryza no Atelier: Tokoyami no Joou to Himitsu no Kakurega background art), Asasaki Nakamura (Inspired) (Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ougonkyou background art)
Art Advisor: Osamu Masuyama (Made in Abyss art director)
3D Design: Emotional Pictures
Music: Ryuuichi Takada (MONACA) (Vivy: Fluorite Eye's Song), Keiichi Hirokawa (MONACA) (Garo: Vanishing Line), Kuniyuki Takahashi (MONACA) (Death March kara Hajimaru Isekai Kyousoukyoku)

Toshiyuki Kubooka (Majo no Tabitabi) is directing the television anime at C2C. Kazuyuki Fudeyasu (Tensei shitara Slime Datta Ken) is handling the series composition and script. Ayumi Kurashima (Devilman: Crybaby) is the character designer and chief animation director.

The anime adapts Katarina and Ryousuke Fuji's action adventure manga. Katarina began writing the series as a web novel on the Shousetsuka ni Narou website in May 2017. Fuji began adapting the story into a manga in Weekly Shounen Magazine in July 2020. Kodansha shipped the 13th volume on May 17, and the 14th volume is scheduled for a July 14 release.

Kodansha USA licensed the manga for digital release in English in November 2020. The 11th volume went on sale on May 2.

PV 2


Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: 'Watashi no Shiawase na Kekkon' Receives OVA Episode in Winter 2024
news.text:
The official website of the Watashi no Shiawase na Kekkon (My Happy Marriage) television anime announced on Friday that the anime will receive an original video anime episode, titled Watashi no Shiawase na Katachi. The new original episode will be released as a bundle with the eighth light novel volume in March 2024.

Produced by Kinema Citrus, the television anime began airing in Summer 2023. Netflix simulcast the anime worldwide.

The television anime adapts Akumi Agitogi's historical drama romance novel, which began on the Shousetsuka ni Narou website in 2018. Kadokawa began printing the series with illustrations by Tsukiho Tsukioka in January 2019. The sixth volume was released in July 2022, and the seventh volume is set for a July 14 release.

Rito Kousaka began drawing a manga adaptation on the Gangan Online web magazine in December 2018. Square Enix released the fourth volume last November.

Yen Press licensed the light novel in English in June 2021, and Square Enix licensed the manga in English under its Manga & Books label the following month. The fourth light novel volume went on sale on June 20. The third manga volume was released on May 9.

Official site: https://watakon-anime.com/
Official Twitter: @watashino_info

Source: animate Times

news.title: Manga 'Kekkon suru tte, Hontou desu ka' Gets TV Anime
news.text:
An official website for a television anime adaptation of Tamiki Wakaki's Kekkon suru tte, Hontou desu ka (365 Days to the Wedding) manga opened on Friday.

Wakaki began serializing the workplace romance manga in Big Comic Spirits magazine in March 2020 and ended on June 12. Shogakukan shipped the 10th volume on April 12. The 11th and final volume is scheduled to release on July 12. Seven Seas Entertainment licensed the manga in English on February 8. The first volume will go on sale on November 14.

Kekkon suru tte, Hontou desu ka received a 10-episode live-action series that premiered in October 2022 on Amazon Prime Video in Japan.

Synopsis
Takuya and Rika are coworkers in a travel agency in Tokyo. They're both single, but they don't mind, since they're introverts with fulfilling lives at home. Unfortunately, now their job is looking to staff an office in Siberia, and non-married employees are the first to be considered. Rika is desperate to avoid the transfer and goes to Takuya with an idea: if they pretend they're getting married in a year, they can stay in Tokyo. The only problem is the two of them barely know each other! If these two quiet coworkers "fake" a relationship, will it turn into something real? (Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)

Official site: https://365-wedding-anime.com/
Official Twitter: @kekkon_anime

Source: animate Times

Kekkon suru tte, Hontou desu ka on MAL

news.title: Light Novel 'Henjin no Salad Bowl' Gets TV Anime
news.text:
A television anime adaptation of Yomi Hirasaka's Henjin no Salad Bowl (Salad Bowl of Eccentrics) light novel has been announced on Thursday and revealed an illustration (pictured) to commemorate the announcement.

Hirasaka began penning the fantasy comedy novel under the Shogakukan's Gagaga Bunko imprint in October 2021, with illustrations by Kantoku. Both previously worked together on the Imouto sae Ireba Ii. (A Sister's All You Need.) light novel. Shogakukan shipped the fourth volume on December 20 and the fifth volume is scheduled to release on July 19.

A manga adaptation by Koutarou Yamada began serializing on the Sunday Webry website on September 27. The second volume went on sale on June 12.

Synopsis
Kaburaya Sosuke, an impoverished detective, meets Sarah, a princess from another world with magical powers. They start living together, and Sarah quickly adjusts her life to modern Japan. (Source: Shogakukan, translated)

Official Light Novel site: https://gagagabunko.jp/special/hensara/
Official Twitter: @hensara_anime

Source: Comic Natalie

Henjin no Salad Bowl on MAL

news.title: Manga 'Yubisaki to Renren' Gets TV Anime for Winter 2024
news.text:
An official website opened for a television anime adaptation of Suu Morishita's Yubisaki to Renren (A Sign of Affection) manga on Wednesday. The website also revealed the main cast, staff, teaser visual (pictured), and a teaser promotional video. The anime is scheduled to premiere in January 2024.

Sumire Morohoshi (Yakusoku no Neverland) and Yuu Miyazaki (Haikyuu!! To the Top) are starring as Yuki Itose and Itsuomi Nagi, respectively.

Staff
Director, Storyboard: Yuuta Murano (Kakushigoto)
Series Composition, Script: Youko Yonaiyama (Paripi Koumei)
Character Design: Kasumi Sakai (Love Live! Sunshine!! The School Idol Movie: Over the Rainbow chief animation director)
Music: Yukari Hashimoto (3-gatsu no Lion)
Studio: Ajia-do

Morishita began serializing the romance manga in Dessert magazine in July 2019. Kodansha shipped the eighth volume on February 13 and will release the ninth volume on July 13.

Kodansha USA licensed the manga in English in March 2020. The sixth volume was released digitally in July last year and in print on May 23.

Yubisaki to Renren was nominated three times at the Kodansha Manga Awards in the Shoujo category in 2021, 2022, and 2023. The manga also placed ninth and 17th in the Kono Manga ga Sugoi! rankings in for the 2021 and 2022's editions.

Synopsis
Yuki Itose is a hearing-impaired university student whose world has been shrouded with silence since birth. She has lived in the same place her whole life, and rarely interacts with others save for her best friend, Rin Fujishiro. During her commute one day, she meets the silver-haired and multilingual Itsuomi Nagi, a mutual friend of Rin. Unlike most, Itsuomi is unwavering when he learns of Yuki's impairment; this, along with his experiences abroad, fascinates and touches her. After they part, her fondness of him starts to grow. A new world begins to open for both Yuki and Itsuomi as they learn about each other's different lives.

Yubisaki to Renren is a lighthearted, romantic comedy that illustrates the silent life of a university student and how one man sharing his world starts to change her own. [Written by MAL Rewrite]

Teaser PV


Official site: https://yubisaki-pr.com/
Official Twitter: @yubisaki_pr

Source: Comic Natalie

Yubisaki to Renren on MAL

news.title: 'Kikansha no Mahou wa Tokubetsu desu' Unveils Production Staff, Additional Cast, First Promo, Fall 2023 Premiere
news.text:
The Crunchyroll Industry panel at Anime Expo 2023 revealed on Monday the production staff, additional cast, opening theme, and first promo for the television anime adaptation of Yu So-nan and Uk-jakga's Kikansha no Mahou wa Tokubetsu desu (A Returner's Magic Should Be Special) manhwa. The anime is scheduled to premiere in October 2023.

Sayumi Suzushiro (Bocchi the Rock!) and Natsumi Fujiwara (Great Pretender) are joining the cast as Romantica Eru and Pram Schneider, respectively.

Staff
Director: Taishi Kawaguchi (Tsuki to Laika to Nosferatu assistant director)
Series Composition, Script: Takamitsu Kouno (Absolute Duo)
Character Design: Hiromi Katou (Guilty Crown)
Art Director: Eiji Iwase (No Game No Life)
Art Assistant: Masahiro Kama (Shinobi no Ittoki background art)
Art Design: Kazushige Kanehira (Spy x Family), Akihiro Hirasawa (Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei), Yasuhiro Okumura (Hyouken no Majutsushi ga Sekai wo Suberu), Tomoyasu Fujise (Tensei shitara Slime Datta Ken)
Prop Design: Shoutarou Hashiguchi (Monster Musume no Oishasan chief animation director)
Color Design: Aiko Matsuyama (Gakusen Toshi Asterisk)
Director of Photography: Hideki Imaizumi (Kumo desu ga, Nani ka?)
Editing: Ryouko Kaneshige (Somali to Mori no Kamisama)
Music: Kenta Higashiooji (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
Sound Director: Takatoshi Hamano (Platinum End)
Sound Effects: Yasumasa Koyama (Dead Mount Death Play)
Sound Production: Magic Capsule
Studio: Arvo Animation

J-rock group FLOW (Naruto, Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch) is performing the opening theme "GET BACK."

Yu and Uk-jakga began serializing the action fantasy manhwa on the KakaoPage website in September 2016. The eighth volume was released in November 2019.

Tappytoon is publishing the manhwa digitally on their website since June 2020. Yen Press licensed the manhwa for physical releases in English on October 2021. The second volume went on sale on April 18.

PV


Source: Press Release

news.title: 'Ore dake Level Up na Ken' Unveils Main Cast, First Promo
news.text:
The Crunchyroll Industry panel at Anime Expo 2023 revealed on Monday the main cast and a promotional video for the Ore dake Level Up na Ken (Solo Leveling) television anime. The anime is scheduled to premiere in January 2024.

Cast
Sung Jin-Woo: Taito Ban (Otonari no Tenshi-sama ni Itsunomanika Dame Ningen ni Sareteita Ken)
Yoo Jin-Ho: Genta Nakamura (Shinmai Renkinjutsushi no Tenpo Keiei)
Baek Yoon-Ho: Hiroki Touchi (Cyberpunk: Edgerunners)
Choi Jong-In: Daisuke Hirakawa (Noblesse)
Cha Hae-In: Reina Ueda (SSSS.Gridman)
Woo Jin-Chul: Makoto Furukawa (One Punch Man)
Go Gun-Hee: Banjou Ginga (Hunter x Hunter (2011))

Shunsuke Nakashige (Megami-ryou no Ryoubo-kun.) is directing the television anime at A-1 Pictures. Noboru Kimura (Kemono Jihen) is handling the series composition. Tomoko Sudou (Fragtime) is designing the characters, and Hiroyuki Sawano (Shingeki no Kyojin) is composing the music.

The anime adapts Chugong's action adventure manhwa, which began as a web novel on the Kakao website and was published by D&C Media from July 2016 to March 2018 in 14 volumes. A webtoon adaptation drawn by Sung-rak Jang began in Kakao in March 2018 and ended on December 29 last year.

Yen Press licensed the manhwa and web novel in English in August 2020 and shipped the sixth volume of the manhwa on March 21. The seventh volume is scheduled to release on August 22.

PV


Source: Press Release

news.title: 'Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari' Season 3 Reveals Additional Cast, Theme Songs
news.text:
The official website of the Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari (The Rising of the Shield Hero) anime series announced on Tuesday additional cast, key visual (pictured), and theme songs for the third season. The new season is scheduled to premiere in October 2023.

Cast
Nadia: Ami Koshimizu (Kill la Kill)
Fohl: Kouhei Amasaki (Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu)
Atla: Konomi Kohara (Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu)
S'yne: Maria Naganawa (Hataraku Saibou)

MADKID (Yuusha Party wo Tsuihou sareta Beast Tamer, Saikyoushu no Nekomimi Shoujo to Deau) is returning to perform the opening theme "SIN." Chiai Fujikawa (Munou na Nana) also returns to perform the ending theme "Suki ni Natte wa Ikenai Riyuu."

Hitoshi Haga (Made in Abyss assistant director) is directing the third season at Kinema Citrus. Scriptwriter Keigo Koyanagi (Sirius), character designer Masahiro Suwa (Hitsugi no Chaika), and music composer Kevin Penkin (Kami no Tou) are returning from the previous seasons.

Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari adapts Yusagi Aneko's adventure fantasy light novel of the same title, which originally launched on the Shousetsuka ni Narou website in October 2012. Kadokawa began printing the novel with illustrations by Seira Minami the following August. The 22nd and final volume was released in June 2019.

One Peace Book licensed the light novel in English and shipped the final volume in December 2021.

Source: Comic Natalie

news.title: 'Kuroshitsuji' Anime Series Gets New Season in 2024
news.text:
The Crunchyroll Industry panel at Anime Expo 2023 announced on Monday that a new season of Kuroshitsuji (Black Butler) is in production. The panel also revealed returning main staff, cast, teaser visual, and teaser promotional video. The anime is scheduled to premiere in 2024.

Daisuke Ono (Shingeki no Kyojin) and Maaya Sakamoto (Bakemonogatari) are returning as Sebastian Michaelis and Ciel Phantomhive, respectively.

Staff
Director: Kenjirou Okada (3-gatsu no Lion)
Series Composition: Hiroyuki Yoshino (Kuroshitsuji: Book of Circus)
Character Design: Yumi Shimizu (Futsuu no Joshikousei ga [Locodol] Yattemita.)
Music: Ryou Kawasaki (Fumetsu no Anata e)
Studio: CloverWorks

The anime series adapt Yana Toboso's fantasy mystery manga which began serialization in GFantasy magazine in September 2006. Square Enix will ship the 33rd volume on July 27. Kuroshitsuji has a cumulative of 34 million copies in circulation.

Yen Press licensed the manga in English and released the 31st volume on May 31 last year. The 32nd volume is scheduled to go on sale on July 18.

A-1 Pictures adapted the manga into three seasons in Fall 2008, Summer 2010, and Summer 2014. They also produced an original video animation and a movie. The latest entry in the series, Book of the Atlantic, opened in theaters in January 2017.

Teaser PV


Official site: https://www.kuroshitsuji.tv/
Official Twitter: @kuroshitsuji2

Source: Press Release

news.title: 'Dosanko Gal wa Namara Menkoi' Reveals Pair of Additional Cast, First Promo, Winter 2024 Premiere
news.text:
The official website of the Dosanko Gal wa Namara Menkoi (Hokkaido Gals Are Super Adorable!) television anime revealed two additional cast members, the first promo, and a key visual (pictured) on Tuesday. The anime series is scheduled to air in January 2024.

Yumiri Hanamori (Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen) and Reina Ueda (Kimetsu no Yaiba) are joining the cast as Sayuri Akino and Rena Natsukawa, respectively.

Misuzu Hoshino (Saikin Yatotta Maid ga Ayashii) is directing the television anime at Silver Link. and Blade. Mirai Minato (Jahy-sama wa Kujikenai! director) is the chief director and is handling the series composition. Katsuyuki Satou (Mamahaha no Tsurego ga Motokano datta) is the character designer.

The anime adapts Kai Ikada's comedy manga, which began serializing on Shueisha's Shounen Jump+ app and website in September 2019. The 11th volume went on sale on July 4. Shueisha began publishing the manga in English on their Manga Plus app and website in September 2020.

PV


Source: Comic Natalie
